00004 namespace CALICE {
00005   
00006   float AhcSimpleTempProvider::getCellTemp( int module, int chip, int chan )
00007   {
00008     if( newCalibCol || newSroModCol || newSanityRange ) {
00009       applyCorrection();
00010     }
00011     
00012     return sensorTemp.at(module-1).at(getSensor(chip,chan));
00013   }
00014   
00015   float AhcSimpleTempProvider::getCellTempError( int module, int chip, int chan )
00016   {
00017     if( newCalibCol || newSroModCol || newSanityRange ) {
00018       applyCorrection();
00019     }
00020     
00021     return sensorTempError.at(module-1).at(getSensor(chip,chan));
00022   }

00024   
00025   float AhcSimpleTempProvider::getAvgModuleTemp( unsigned module )
00026   {
00027     if( newCalibCol || newSroModCol || newSanityRange ) {
00028       applyCorrection();
00029     }
00030     
00031     return _moduleMeanTemp[module-1];   
00032   }
00033   
00034   
00035   float AhcSimpleTempProvider::getAvgTemp()
00036   {
00037     if( newCalibCol || newSroModCol || newSanityRange ) {
00038       applyCorrection();
00039     }
00040     
00041     return _caloMeanTemp;
00042   }
00043   
00044   
00045   float AhcSimpleTempProvider::getSensorTemp( int module, int sensor )
00046   {
00047     if( newCalibCol || newSroModCol || newSanityRange ) 
00048       {
00049         applyCorrection();
00050       }
00051     
00052     if (sensor > 4) throw std::invalid_argument( "AhcSimpleTempProvider::"
00053                                                  "AhcSimpleTempProvider::getSensorTemp: "
00054                                                  " sensor out of range ( > 4)" );
00055     return sensorTemp.at(module-1).at(sensor);
00056   }
00057   
00058   
00059   
00063   int AhcSimpleTempProvider::getSensor( int chip, int chan )
00064   {
00065     if( chip == 0 ) return 0;
00066     else if( (chip > 0) && (chip < 4) ) return 1;
00067     else if( (chip > 3) && (chip < 8) ) return 2;
00068     else if( (chip > 7) && (chip < 11) ) return 3;
00069     else if( chip == 11 ) return 4;
00070     
00071     throw std::out_of_range( "AhcSimpleTempProvider::getSensor(): "
00072                              "argument chip out of range (0...11)");
00073     
00074     return 0; //never happens logically 
00075   }
00076   
00077   bool AhcSimpleTempProvider::isBadValue( float t )
00078   {
00079     return (t<_sanityMin) || (t>_sanityMax);
00080   }
00081   
00082   void AhcSimpleTempProvider::applyCorrection()
00083   {
00084     if(!_sroModCol) throw std::invalid_argument( "AhcSimpleTempProvider::"
00085                                                  "applyCorrection(): "
00086                                                  " null pointer _sroModCol!" );
00087     
00088     //  throw an exception when no sensor calib is available - 
00089     //    this is essential to retain consistency for correction of T-drifts.
00090     //  Catch this exception in your code if you can live without absolute
00091     //    temperature values
00092     //    if(!_calibCol) throw std::invalid_argument( "AhcSimpleTempProvider::"
00093     //                                          "applyCorrection(): "
00094     //                                          " null pointer _calibCol!" );
00095     
00096     if( newCalibCol || newSroModCol ) {
00097       updateCache();
00098     }
00099     
00100     _caloMeanTemp=0;
00101     _caloMeanTempRMS=0;
00102     _caloMeanCount=0;
00103     
00104     //holds all the modules that do not have any sensor in sanity range
00105     vector<int> bad_mods;
00106     
00107     for( int i=0; i<_sroModCol->getNumberOfElements(); i++ ) {
00108       CALICE::AhcSlowReadoutModBlock mb( _sroModCol->getElementAt(i) );
00109       
00110       int module = mb.getModuleNumber()-1;
00111       _moduleMeanTemp[module]=0;
00112       _moduleMeanTempRMS[module]=0;
00113       _moduleMeanCount[module]=0;
00114       
00115       for(unsigned s=0; s<N_SENSORS && s<mb.getCmbTemperatures().size(); s++)
00116         {
00117           //we calculate the mean, excluding bad sensors
00118           if(!isBadValue(sensorTemp[module][s])) {
00119             _moduleMeanTemp[module]    += sensorTemp[module][s];
00120             _moduleMeanTempRMS[module] += sensorTemp[module][s] * sensorTemp[module][s];
00121             _moduleMeanCount[module]++;
00122             
00123             _caloMeanTemp += sensorTemp[module][s];
00124             _caloMeanTempRMS += sensorTemp[module][s] * sensorTemp[module][s];
00125             _caloMeanCount++; 
00126           }
00127         }
00128       
00129       if(_moduleMeanCount[module]>0) {
00130         _moduleMeanTemp[module] /= _moduleMeanCount[module];
00131         _moduleMeanTempRMS[module] /= _moduleMeanCount[module];
00132         _moduleMeanTempRMS[module] -= _moduleMeanTemp[module] * _moduleMeanTemp[module];
00133         _moduleMeanTempRMS[module] = sqrt( _moduleMeanTempRMS[module] );
00134         
00135         //now take out the bad guys and replace'em with the mean
00136         for( unsigned s=0; s<N_SENSORS; s++ ) {
00137           if(isBadValue(sensorTemp[module][s])) {
00138             sensorTemp[module][s]      = _moduleMeanTemp[module];
00139             sensorTempError[module][s] = _moduleMeanTempRMS[module];
00140           }
00141         }
00142       } else {
00143         bad_mods.push_back(module); 
00144       }
00145     }
00146     
00147     if(_caloMeanCount>0) {
00148       _caloMeanTemp /= _caloMeanCount;
00149       _caloMeanTempRMS /= _caloMeanCount;
00150     }
00151     
00152     for(unsigned i=0; i<bad_mods.size(); i++) {
00153       fill(sensorTemp[bad_mods[i]].begin(),sensorTemp[bad_mods[i]].end(), _caloMeanTemp );
00154       
00155       fill( sensorTempError[bad_mods[i]].begin(),
00156             sensorTempError[bad_mods[i]].end(),
00157             _caloMeanTempRMS
00158             );
00159     }
00160     
00161     newCalibCol = false;
00162     newSroModCol = false;
00163     newSanityRange = false;
00164   }
00165   
00166 }
